image.altText: A toy plane and globe sitting on a table at a child care centre

props.synopsis: More concerns have been raised about safety at childcare centres, with three-quarters of workers telling a survey their place of work was operating below minimum staffing levels at least weekly.

title.children: Childcare operators accused of using staffing loopholes to undercut laws

image.altText: Qantas Departure sign outside airport terminal

props.synopsis: Qantas customers say they feel vulnerable, angry and unsupported following last week's major cyber security breach — and are now questioning whether the airline is doing enough to protect Australians' personal data.

title.children: Qantas customers furious after massive cyber data breach

image.altText: Donald Trump turns his head to look back at Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The US president says he has authorised the delivery of more weapons to Ukraine, while he is considering "very strongly" a bill to levy a 500 per cent tariff on countries that continue to buy Russian oil.

title.children: 'A lot of bulls***': Trump lashes Putin and U-turns on weapons for Ukraine

image.altText: Erin Patterson pic for Annabel Crabb analysis

props.synopsis: We need people to be good, or to be evil. We need a cause to be unimpeachable, or reprehensible. How else to explain the unscratchable itch that the trial of Erin Patterson has become for humans all over the world?

title.children: The real reason Erin Patterson's trial became an unscratchable itch for millions

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: During her long trial, Erin Patterson was forced to sleep in a concrete cell that was not only bitterly cold but also deafeningly loud. Now she's facing life in prison.

title.children: Erin Patterson could take years to adjust to maximum security, expert says

image.altText: CCTV frame shows Erin Patterson standing by the Leongatha Hospital entrance speaking to a nurse, both wear masks.

props.synopsis: A doctor who first alerted police to now convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson describes the moment he grew suspicious of her.

title.children: Erin Patterson labelled 'evil' by doctor who came face-to-face with killer

image.altText: Water damaged mattresses and bags stacked outside a cabin building.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump pledges to provide whatever relief Texas needs to recover from the flooding.

title.children: Breaking: 161 people still missing from Texas floods that killed more than 100

image.altText: Michele Bullock gestures standing behind a microphone, with RBA logo behind her

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank shocked most experts, and borrowers, by keeping interest rates on hold in July, but does it mean we might see a super-sized cut in August?

title.children: Why we'll know if RBA will cut rates in August in three weeks' time

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks and holds his hands open while Pete Hegseth, seated next to him, watches.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump flags a possible 200 per cent tariff on pharmaceuticals — one of Australia's biggest exports to the US — and says copper could be hit with a 50 per cent levy.

title.children: Trump flags tariffs of 200pc on pharmaceuticals, 50pc on copper

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Australia is "urgently" seeking clarification after US President Donald Trump flagged a possible 200 per cent tariff on pharmaceuticals. Follow live.

title.children: Australia 'urgently' seeking further detail on Trump's pharmaceutical tariffs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia 'urgently' seeking detail on Trump's latest tariff proposal

image.altText: A worked scoops up heavy snow at Thredbo resoirt

props.synopsis: Parts of the country have recorded their coldest June mornings in decades, but on average, winters are getting warmer.

title.children: Colder than Antarctica, as June brings winter chill to eastern states

image.altText: Michael Balderstone prepares a cannabis joint.

props.synopsis: AHPRA says poor prescribing practices and surging consumer demand are leading to "significant" patient harm, and releases new guidelines urging prescribers to put patient wellbeing above profits.

title.children: Action taken against over 50 practitioners in medicinal cannabis crackdown

image.altText: A woman sits in a wheel chair in a well-lit room surrounded by art supplies.

props.synopsis: Carol Taylor's mammogram was cancelled because she uses a wheelchair. When she eventually got a scan, she was diagnosed with breast cancer.

title.children: Carol was denied a mammogram. Now she's having treatment for breast cancer

image.altText: overhead picture of several houses joined together.

props.synopsis: Two families in this coastal city design their homes to squeeze adult kids, grandparents, and great-grandkids inside.

title.children: Four generations under one roof as a way to combat the housing crisis

image.altText: A white alpaca standing in a field.

props.synopsis: An unlikely hero has emerged in the fight against an "absolutely terrifying" virus which has again reared its head in Australia.

title.children: Why a cute Chilean alpaca named Pedro could hold the key to stopping a deadly virus

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is likely to fall slightly in morning trade after yesterday's surprise decision by the Reserve Bank to keep interest rates on hold. Wall Street finished trading flat after Donald Trump gave mixed signals about whether he would allow extensions to his new August 1 tariff deadline. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to slip after RBA's surprise interest rate decision, Trump announces further tariffs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How long will borrowers have to wait for the next RBA rate cut?
RBA interest rate cut in August looks all but certain, but how big will it be?
Trump flags tariffs of 200pc on pharmaceuticals, 50pc on copper

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white moustache and beard, white hair, red vest over black shirt with a sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi Walker's family members have welcomed the Northern Territory coroner's findings after six years of waiting for answers. As they mourn the death of another loved one, they say the fight for justice isn't over.

title.children: 'We felt racism killed Kumanjayi': Yuendumu responds to coronial finding

image.altText: a man and woman smile at the camera with their arm around each other whilst holding rowing ores and kayak paddles in other hand

props.synopsis: After four months of dust storms and chilblains, Anja Wever and Cy Wever-Jetis say giving up was never an option.

title.children: Mother-son duo first to travel entire 2,500km of Murray River

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka roars in celebration while holding racquet

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka is forced to dig deep to set up a semifinal date against Amanda Anisimova after being pushed to the brink by world number 104 Laura Siegemund.

title.children: Sabalenka advances to Wimbledon semifinal after surviving huge scare

image.altText: Taylor Fritz gestures with his racquet in his right hand

props.synopsis: Wimbledon's new electronic line-calling system malfunctions causing a point to be replayed during Taylor Fritz's quarterfinal clash with Karen Khachanov.

title.children: Fritz sets up Alcaraz date amid more Wimbledon line-calling drama

image.altText: A man and a woman stand near a 3D printed model of an aorta in a lab

props.synopsis: The Queensland man's aorta, the biggest blood vessel in the body, had ballooned to about four times the usual size, leaving it in danger of rupturing.

title.children: Surgeons and engineers work together to save Queensland man's life

image.altText: A sign is pictured outside a post office, in London

props.synopsis: The inquiry also finds that hundreds of people were wrongly prosecuted and convicted of theft, fraud and false accounting due to incorrect data in an information technology system.

title.children: Inquiry says at least 13 people took their life as a result of UK's Post Office scandal

image.altText: A group of girls pose together in a park wearing warm clothing.

props.synopsis: Meet the teen 'Luddites' who want to "empower young people" to rethink their relationship with their phones.

title.children: What Australia can learn from these unconventional tech-free methods

image.altText: A soccer player in a yellow and green jersey sits on the ground and raises her arms in triumph.

props.synopsis: Joe Montemurro admits his side has a mountain of work to do despite managing to escape with a stoppage time win over Panama courtesy of a late Charlie Grant winner.

title.children: Matildas coach laments 'technical errors' in last-gasp win over Panama

image.altText: Training documents containing text, bullet points, and redacted sections, displayed against a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: The ABC asked for details of concerns raised about children being detained in adult prisons — and got more in return than it expected.

title.children: The ABC was sent a document twice: redacted and unredacted. Here's what we found

image.altText: South Australia Livestock Exchange 2025-06-03 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Australia's sheep flock continues to decrease due to drought, with ewe numbers expected to drop 9 per cent over the next year.

title.children: Australia's sheep flock shrinks with at least two years until recovery

image.altText: A smiling woman standing in front of a fly screen door.

props.synopsis: Pilbara suburbs dominated a recent report detailing communities across Australia where a mortgage is a cheaper option than weekly rent.

title.children: As rents pass $1,300 per week, it's cheaper to buy a house in the Pilbara

image.altText: Dad of patient looks through an octogon shape beaming at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

title.children: This theatre show has an unusual stage: the end of a hospital bed

image.altText: Marco Rubio wearing a suit and tie at a Senate hearing, with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: A US diplomatic cable says the impersonator attempted to contact three foreign ministers and two US politicians, with the goal of attempting to access information or accounts.

title.children: AI scammer posing as Marco Rubio targets foreign ministers, US politicians

image.altText: People carrying a coffin with a cloth with a star of David

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says the five soldiers "fell during combat in the northern Gaza Strip".

title.children: Five Israeli soldiers killed as Gaza ceasefire talks continue

image.altText: A photo of a building with a colourful logo and the words Perth Children's Hospital on the top.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest is set to examine Symerien Brooking's death at Perth Children's Hospital last August after her mother shared her story, and her pleas for answers.

title.children: Inquest to be held into death of 10yo girl who waited hours for CT scan

image.altText: A man slouched next to a tree

props.synopsis: Moreton Bay Council says homeless people consented to leaving their tent sites and having their possessions thrown into a council rubbish truck.

title.children: Council says homeless people consented to having camps destroyed

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The body of Hannah McGuire, 23, was found last year in a torched car and her ex-partner charged with the killing. He is today expected to plead not guilty before a jury.

title.children: Trial set to start for Ballarat woman's accused murderer

image.altText: Woman with pink mohawk and black short sleeved shirt

props.synopsis: A new virtual hub and reduced medication costs are expected to make an "enormous difference" to women suffering from menopause and perimenopause symptoms.

title.children: Lucy suffered for a decade with a condition 'neglected for many years'

image.altText: Profile shot of man with grey hair, a brunette woman facing him and holding his face in both her hands

props.synopsis: Made as a way to cope with grief over losing his wife, legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg's latest movie looks at what happens when technology intrudes on the very human matter of death.

title.children: Legendary 81yo filmmaker processes his grief through haunting tech horror
